newsitem.title: UK: N.Irish blasts were caused by bombs - police.
newsitem.headline: N.Irish blasts were caused by bombs - police.

text.p: Two explosions at Britain's Northern Ireland army headquarters at Lisburn, south of Belfast, were caused by bombs, a police spokeswoman said on Monday.
Asked whether the explosions were caused by bombs, the spokeswoman said: "Yes, I'm telling you they (the blasts) were caused by bombs."
Police said there were "multiple casualties" and hospitals were told to expect upwards of 20 victims of the explosion, some with leg injuries and others with burns.
